1.content:
Finally... it's here! From your upstairs home office, you see the postman stuff a handful of mail into your mailbox. Once he's sped off to the next house down the street, you dash through the house and out the front door, sprinting for the mailbox. You grab everything out of it and eagerly sift through the contents, looking for the big fat royalty check that they promised you'd receive today.

It's not there.

Your heart sinks at the thought of another day going by with only $5.61 to your name.

As you're sorting through the rest of the mail, you notice a plain white envelope with your name and address handwritten in black marker. No return address.

Curious, you tuck the rest of the mail under your arm and tear open the envelope, pulling out the single piece of paper off a canary yellow legal pad. Scrawled on it is a short message:

Keep this safe, old friend:

5 551 96 7 328

- VNC"


You stare at the plain note for several moments, trying to figure out what it means. You think of old friends, and somewhere from the recesses of your brain, you remember Vincent Nathan Carver, a friend from high school that you haven't spoken to in over ten years.

What do you do with the note?
1.title: How It All Begins

11.content: You crumple up the letter and throw it away. You never did have much use for riddles or mysteries or anything like that. You live a long and uneventful life, content in your ignorance.
11.title: Ignore it

12.content:
You head back inside, staring at the numbers on the page, trying to figure out what the numbers mean. You try grouping the numbers differently.

You decide...
12.title: Figure out what it means

121.content:
555-196-7328

You pick up the house phone and call the number. It rings several times before an answering machine picks up.

"You've reached 555-196-7328. No one is available to take your call at the moment..."

Confused, you're about to hang up, when...

"... but if you're an old friend, meet me at our usual stomping grounds. Same time, same place. And remember this number."

What do you do?
121.title: It's a phone number!

choices: Nope, I'm just here for the pizza
1211.content:
The Pizza Palace.

That's where you and Vince used to hang out when you were in school. Whether it was studying for finals or kicking back on a Friday night, people could always find you and the gang here. It took four hours to drive all the way back to your hometown, but the cryptic note and answering machine message were too much to ignore. Before leaving, you decided to commit the number to memory and destroy the note, just in case.

You push through the door to the restaurant and look around. Aside from the sweaty, overweight guy operating the pizza oven behind the counter, the place is empty.

You slide into a corner booth and wait.

Before long, the front door swings open to reveal a knockout brunette, dangerously curvy and poured into stiletto heels and a mini-dress. In a small country town like this one, she can't help but stand out.

She saunters over to you.

"Hi," she offers. "You waiting for Vince?"
1211.title: Go to meet him

12111.content:
"Yeah," you reply. "I'm waiting for Vince."

She slides into the booth across from you and extends her hand.

"I'm Adrienne. Vince asked me to come get you."

You look at her suspiciously. She puts her hands up, acquiescing.

"I know, I know. It's weird, right? You get a strange letter from an old friend and now you've got a woman asking you to follow her. I promise, I'll explain everything in due course. But before we go any further, I need those ten digits that Vince gave you."

What do you do?
12111.title: Absolutely

121111.content:
"Of course," you reply. "The numbers are 5551967328."

A wide smile spreads across Adrienne's lips. She pulls out a cell phone and speed dials a number.

"Yeah, it's 5551967328. Can you verify? ... Perfect. Yeah, I'll be there soon."

Adrienne hangs up the phone and slides out of the booth, extending her hand to you.

"Come on. I'll explain everything on the way."

You follow her out of The Pizza Palace.

"My car's around back."

You trail Adrienne as she rounds the corner of the building and into the back alley. Suddenly, she spins around and you feel a searing pain in your gut. Looking down, you see her slowly pull a knife out of your stomach.

You wince as she twists the blade, carving up your insides.

She leans forward and whispers in your ear.

"Thanks for the account number."

You begin to feel dizzy from the loss of blood. After stabbing you twice more, Adrienne lets you collapse to the ground and climbs into her car, speeding off into the night.

The world goes black around you.
121111.title: Sure, the numbers are 5551967328

choices: Nah, I'll follow her in my own car
121112.content:
"I'm sorry," you reply. "But not until I know what's going on."

"Fair enough. Follow me."

Adrienne slides out of the booth and offers you her hand. You follow her lead out of The Pizza Palace and to her car.

Do you get in the car?
121112.title: No, don't tell her

1211121.content:
You slide into the passenger seat while Adrienne moves around to the driver's side. You're about to turn to her and say something when she pushes the metal prongs of a taser into your chest and flips the switch. You have the briefest moment of coherence before feeling yourself lose control of your body and pass out.


Coming to your senses, you look around. You're in a hotel room, on the bed. You try to move around, but find that you've been tied to the bed, one limb bound to each bedpost.

"Glad you're awake," Adrienne notes as she emerges from the bathroom. "Now we can get started. I need that account number from you. And you can either give it to me right now, or after a great deal of pain and suffering. The choice is yours."
1211121.title: Yeah, why not?

12111211.content: You fork over the account number, along any self-respect and courage you may have once had. After giving them the account number, Adrienne's associate takes out a silenced pistol and unceremoniously puts two bullets in your head.
12111211.title: Sing like a canary

12111212.content:
You smirk.

"Drop the tough act. This is the United States of America. I'm a U.S. citizen. You'd never get away with torturing me.

Twelve hours, two dozen broken bones, three pulled teeth, and an electroshock treatment later, you've told them your entire life history, as well as the account number, how you know Vince, and anything else they could have possibly wanted to know.

**********

The van ride is a bumpy one. After what seems like hours, the van stops and the back doors are opened, letting in the harsh desert sun. You're pushed out of the van, chair, chains and all as the van speeds away.

You look around and find what seems to be endless desert stretching out in every direction. Even if you could get out of the chair... which you can't... you have a hell of a walk in front of you.

Vultures slowly circle overhead.
12111212.title: Hold out

choices: The easy way... please don't hurt me!
The hard way... do your worst!
1211122.content:
"If it's all the same, I'll take my own car," you say.

Adrienne shrugs.

"Whatever you wanna do."

She watches you climb into your car. You insert the key into the ignition, and the last thing you remember is something hard hitting the back of your head with a thud.


You wake up with a bright light in your eyes, blinding you to the darkened room beyond. You try to move, but find that you've been secured to a chair, heavy chains locked around your torso, arms and legs. You try to move around, but it's futile.

"I didn't want it to come to this," Adrienne said from somewhere out in the darkness. "But you wouldn't be a good boy and just play along."

She steps into your field of view, silhouetted by the spotlight. Standing beside her is an imposing-looking man who's built like a freight train.

"I'm afraid I'm going to need that account number now," she presses. "And, as cliched as it is, I figure I should at least give you the option of doing this the easy way or the hard way."
1211122.title: Nah, I'll follow her in my own car

12111221.content:
You give up the info without a second thought.

"It's 5551967328!" You blurt out.

"Thank you," Adrienne says.

She turns to her associate. "Get rid of him. Make it look like an accident."

You stare up, wide-eyed as the hulking man steps toward you and obscures everything else, even the light.
12111221.title: The easy way... please don't hurt me!

choices: Okay, okay... don't hurt me anymore!
I'm still not telling you anything!
12111222.content:
Your jaw explodes in pain as the first punch connects with the side of your head. Then another to the side of your head and another to your eye, which you know will be black and blue in a matter of seconds. The behemoth of a man is using you as his personal punching bag, and the vicious beating continues for what seems like forever.

Then, mercifully, it stops.

You gasp for air while the barrage of fists rests.

"Please," Adrienne says. "Give us the account number. You don' t have to do this."

You taste blood in your mouth from a busted lip and spit it on the ground.

You take a moment to weigh your options.
12111222.title: The hard way... do your worst!

121112221.content:
You're not sure what the significance of the account number is, but it sure as hell beats getting wailed on by the ape looming over you.

"5551967328."

Adrienne smiles. "See? That wasn't so hard, was it?"

You sag in the chair, defeated.

"Why don't you take our guest out back and show him the swamplands?" Adrienne laughs.


The last thing you remember is being tossed, chair and all, into the murky swamp waters out in the middle of nowhere, slowly sinking beneath the surface as sludge fills your mouth and nostrils.
121112221.title: Okay, okay... don't hurt me anymore!

choices: Try to escape while you still can!
Trust her and give up the number
121112222.content:
Adrienne sighs.

"I guess we're going to have to try more extreme measures."

She turns to her associate.

"Why don't you go get the electrodes?"

You hear her associate leave the room, a metal door slamming behind him. Adrienne approaches you, dangling a key.

"You see this key?" She questions. "This key is the only way you're getting out of here. and I'm not unlocking the chains until we get that number. If we have to beat you, electrocute you, hold your head underwater... whatever it takes, we're going to get that account number out of you."

"What's so important about this account?" You ask.

Adrienne smiles. "Your friend Vince stole a good deal of money from us. My associate and I are in charge of getting it back."

"This is all about money? You're beating me half to death for an account number so you can reclaim, what, a couple hundred thousand dollars?"

Adrienne approaches you and straddles your lap, leaning forward and staring straight into your eyes.

"Try a couple hundred million dollars."

Your jaw almost hits the floor. You can't even comprehend that much money, let alone how your friend Vince, who never seems that adept at anything, managed to steal it.

Adrienne again dangles the key in front of you.

"This key will set you free," she teases. "So why not tell me what I want to know, and we'll all be happy. I can get my money back, and you can get your life back. If you hold out on us, we have to interrogate you some more."

What do you do?
121112222.title: I'm still not telling you anything!

choices: Get the hell out of there
Take advantage of a beautiful, bound woman
1211122221.content:
You don't waste any time. When Adrienne leans in, you reel back and head butt her full in the face, causing her to drop the key and sending her sprawling across the room. You throw yourself over the in the chair, scooting over to grab the key while Adrienne desperately tries to regain her bearings.

You beat her to the punch and manage to unlock yourself, freeing yourself from your bonds. Not wasting any time, you switch positions with her, wrapping the chains around her body, securing her to the chair.

Now you're faced with two options...
1211122221.title: Try to escape while you still can!

choices: Just what Vince said... make the world a better place.
Screw everyone... keep the money for yourself
12111222211.content:
You waste no time getting the hell out of there, while Adrienne screams at you from the confines of her chair. After escaping from the warehouse and feeling reasonably sure that no one was able to follow you, the next step is to figure out what kind of an account number that is.

Stopping at an internet cafe, you begin surfing through bank websites. Then, you remember back to the message Vince left for you. The Pizza Palace was your old stomping grounds at home, you also spent a great deal of time in the Cayman Islands. On a hunch, you start checking banks on the islands and come across a positive match at the Grand Cayman Bank. To your surprise, you're listed as a trustee on the account.

Taking the next plane out, you arrive in the Cayman Islands and head immediately to the bank, where you're ushered into a private room. Before long, the bank manager arrives.

"As instructed by the primary account holder, the funds in account number 5551967328 are completely at your disposal. Provided, however, that you listen the following in its entirety."

He hands you a digital voice recorder. Nervously, you push the playback button.

"Hey, it's Vince. If you're listening to this right now, I'm probably dead. Hopefully you found your way here without too much trouble. I set this whole thing up with Adrienne, and if things are going as planned, the two of you are sitting here right now listening to this message. However, if you're sitting here by yourself, that means I was right not to completely trust Adrienne when I sent the account number to you. Anyway, however you've arrived here, the important thing is that I want you to have this money. I want you to use to do all the good we said we were going to do in this world. Take care old friend... and thanks."

What do you do with the money?
12111222211.title: Get the hell out of there

121112222111.content:
$10 million to Habitat For Humanity. $5 million to Greenpeace. $8 million to Amnesty International. $15 million worth of new books and computers for schools. You blaze through the $206,318,028 in the account, donating large amounts of money to any and every notable charity you can think of, all anonymously. After it's all spent, you smile and hand the bank manager the list of deposits.

"You're sure this is how you'd like the money disbursed?"

"Yes," you reply. "It's what we've always wanted."

"In that case," the bank manager continues, "I have been instructed to give this to you."

He slides an envelope and another digital voice recorder over to you. You play the recording. It's Vince again.

"If you're listening to this, then you've accomplished what we've always talked about and hopefully made the world a better place. Now, it's time to make your world a better place. I've set aside some money to thank you for your help with this. Take it and live your life to the fullest, doing all the things you've ever wanted to do."

You open the envelope and see a check with your name printed on it... for the amount of $20,000,000. Although you'll have to lay low for the rest of your life to avoid Adrienne and the other people after the money, you take some consolation in the fact that this money will help you disappear, hiding out on a desert island and enjoying the rest of your days in a tropical paradise.
121112222111.title: Just what Vince said... make the world a better...

121112222112.content:
You spend the next several months buying everything your heart could possibly desire. Big houses all over the world. Exotic sports cars. Crazy parties filled with beautiful women. Life couldn't get much better.

One day, you're sitting out on the beach sipping a mai tai, when a shadow looms over you.

"We've been looking for you a long time," a familiar voice says.

You look up and see Adrienne with her muscle-bound associate towering over you.

"I have to admit, when you escaped from that warehouse, I thought you were gone for good. You had the means and opportunity to escape with the money and never be seen again. Too bad you made such high profile purchases. Now, let's discuss your repayment plan..."

Her silent thug leans over and grabs you, dragging you toward a van, kicking and screaming.
121112222112.title: Screw everyone... keep the money for yourself

12111222212.content: Your mind begins to play over all the potential scenarios that you could act out with the beautiful Adrienne chained up. Unfortunately, you forgot that she had an associate, who returns and snaps your neck before you can carry out any of your fantasies.
12111222212.title: Take advantage of a beautiful, bound woman

1211122222.content:
"Okay," you relent. "Since it's your money anyway, the account number is 5551967328."

Adrienne gets up off your lap.

"Thank you," she says. "See, that wasn't so hard, was it?"

"Now can I go?" You ask.

Adrienne laughs. "Don't you watch movies? You know we can't let you go now..."

Her associate comes back with some intimidating-looking electroshock equipment.

"He already gave up the number," she tells him. "So we can dispense with the unpleasantness and move right to a lethal jolt."

You struggle against your chains as they attach electrodes to your temples. The last thing you remember is excruciating pain as electricity courses through your body, scrambling your brains and causing you to lose all control of your bodily functions.
1211122222.title: Trust her and give up the number

12112.content:
She gives you a hard look.

"You sure?"

You nod your head. "Yeah, I'm just waiting for my pizza."

"You know, if you were waiting for Vince, I'd have an important message from him."

"But I'm not, so thanks anyway."

The woman shrugs her shoulders and heads out of The Pizza Palace. You wait around the joint for hours, but nothing happens. You begin to feel like maybe you missed out on your chance to solve the mystery.
12112.title: Nope, I'm just here for the pizza

1212.content: You ignore the answering machine message, figuring it's either too much of a hassle, or too dangerous to undertake. Whatever your rationale, you go on living the rest of your life without giving it another thought. Soon, even the memory of the strange note begins to fade.
1212.title: Ignore The Message

122.content:
You become convinced that it's a bank account and set about checking each and every one of them. Unfortunately, considering there are more than 7,600 commercial banks in the United States alone, it becomes an obsession for you... and you spend the rest of your life rambling on to anyone who will listen about the mysterious bank account that your friend sent you.

If you could only find the right bank... Just a few more calls...
122.title: It's a bank account!

123.content: Unfortunately, you cannot figure out what that something else is.
123.title: It's something else!

info.brief_description: A cryptic note from an old friend forces you into a dangerous situation.
info.description:
You're an ordinary citizen of Anytown, USA. You have a house, a steady job and always pay your bills on time. You're an upstanding member of the community and the worst trouble you've ever been in is getting picked up with some friends for being drunk and disorderly at a college party.

You have a good life, but nothing extraordinary.

All that is about to change...
